This was a study where we -- we didn't just change memory for turning a stop sign into a yield sign, but we planted entire events into the minds of research witnesses, events that did not happen. And then we measured people's emotional reactions to these false memories. So we planted false memories, for example, that you witnessed your parents having a physically violent fight when you were a kid or that you accidentally caught your parents, you know, having sex when you were a kid. And once we succeeded in planting these false memories and measured people's emotional reactions, they were just as emotional about these created memories as other individuals were who truly had had those experiences. So the bottom line there was that emotion is no guarantee that you're dealing with an authentic memory. Q.
